name: KOI-13
scenarioDescription:
The KOI-13 Exoplanetary System


Overview

KOI-13 is a star with 1.72 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.74 times its radius. It is located 1353.5474 light years away from the solar system.

KOI-13 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KOI-13 system

KOI-13 b

KOI-13 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the Transit method. The mass of KOI-13 b is 2949.4624 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KOI-13 b is 16.948 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, KOI-13 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, KOI-13 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system KOI-13, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
